item.title: Capabilities vs. Routines: Operationalizing Dynamic Strategy with Corporate Foresight (Part 2/3)
item.dc:creator: Anthony Faustine
item.description: We break down the two main theoretical approaches to Dynamic Capabilities—the managerial Capabilities view and the process-oriented Routines view—and introduce Corporate Foresight as a key cultivation mechanism.

item.title: Dynamic Capabilities: Why Reconfiguring Resources is Your Only Path to Long-Term Success (Part 1/3)
item.dc:creator: Anthony Faustine
item.description: Explore the fundamental concept of Dynamic Capabilities, why possessing resources is no longer enough, and how leading scholars define the engine of strategic renewal.

item.title: Shared Mental Models: The Invisible Architecture of High-Performance Teams
item.dc:creator: Anthony Faustine
item.description: This post explores how shared mental models common understandings of goals, roles, and teamwork—form the foundation of high performing teams. It also highlights the crucial role of leadership in developing and sustaining these models, especially in virtual and hybrid environments.

item.title: The Lone Wolf vs. The Pack: Why Your Change Strategy Is Failing
item.dc:creator: Anthony Faustine
item.description: This post explores how Kurt Lewin’s theory of group dynamics reveals that lasting organizational change depends less on individual effort and more on engaging and transforming the collective forces within groups.
